page.title: 06TRADE
page.content: On leaving the carpark we noticed on our right a field from which the potato crop had been lifted. {Gribbin Head-Trade-Fishing __________________________ From the Gribbin Headland we noticed the ships at sea as we walked along.We saw three trawlers,six yachts,one china clay slurry ship called the 'Condor' and three motor boats.A dredger barge was being towed in by a tug. {Gribbin Head-Trinity House __________________________ At night,in fog or in bad weather the Trinity House light sited at St. Catherine's Point flashes to warn shiping. {Gribbin Head-Cannis Rocks _________________________ Off the Gribbin Head lies the Cannis Rocks which can be dangerous.The
